short_summary: Request for Proposal - Effects of Student Background on Post-Secondary Education Access
description: Notice of Proposed Procurement Effects of Student Background on Post Secondary Education Access, Persistence, and Completion and Labour Market Outcomes in British Columbia This requirement is for Employment and Social Development Canada (amendment 1): This requirement is open only to those Supply Arrangement Holders under ProServices who qualified under the National Capital Region (NCR) for the following stream and category: Stream 9. Business Consulting/ Change Management Category 9.9 Statistical Analyst Level of expertise: Senior Number of Resources: 1 (minimum) The following SA Holders have been invited to submit a proposal: 1) Deloitte Inc. 2) SRDC (The Social Research and Demonstration Corporation) Description of the Requirement: The objective of this research is to examine student and family background characteristics of British Columbia (BC) high school students. The research would provide data on student academic pathways and transitions from kindergarten to grade 12 (K-12) through to post-secondary education (PSE) and into the labour market. Specifically, the research will examine trends in PSE access, persistence and graduation over time, barriers to PSE experienced by youth in BC, and labour market outcomes. Furthermore, the analysis will examine how PSE access, persistence, completion and any barriers to PSE are related to a range of student, family, neighbourhood , K-12 school program , school type , and other characteristics. This research will support policy development regarding youth, especially those from under-served communities, and their efforts to access, persist and complete higher education. Results from this research will provide the foundation for similar research in other jurisdictions, allowing for a pan-Canadian analysis regarding students pathway through the education system and transitions into the labour market. Level of Security Requirement: No security requirements apply to this solicitation Applicable Trade Agreements: This requirement is not subject to the provisions of any trade agreement. Proposed period of contract: From contract award to March 31, 2024. Solicitation Number: 100021823 Contracting Authority: Marco Quiroga Email: NC-SOLICITATIONS-GD@hrsdc-rhdcc.gc.ca
